canonical.name: Tchong Fou
canonical.title: 61. Tchong Fou / The Interior Truth
canonical.judgment: Tchong Fou moves even pigs and fish, and leads to good fortune. There will be advantage in crossing the great stream. There will be advantage in being firm and correct.
canonical.image: The trigram representing the waters of a marsh, and that for wind above it, form Tchong Fou. The superior person, in accordance with this, deliberates about causes of litigations and delays the infliction of death.

1.text: shows its subject resting in their self. There will be good fortune. If they sought to rest in any other, they would not find rest.

2.text: shows its subject like the crane crying out in her hidden retirement, and her young ones responding to her. It is as if it were said, 'I have a cup of good spirits', and the response were, 'I will partake of it with you.'

3.text: shows its subject having met with their mate. Now they beat their drum, and now they leave off. Now they weep, and now they sing.

4.text: shows its subject like the moon nearly full, and like a horse in a chariot whose fellow disappears. There will be no error.

5.text: shows its subject perfectly sincere, and linking others to them in closest union. There will be no error.

6.text: shows its subject on a rooster trying to mount to heaven. Even with firm correctness there will be evil.

metadata.notes: Original translation preserved from pyChing v1.2.2
